<title type="main">A Collection of Psalm Tunes with a few Anthems and Hymns Some of them Entirely New</title>
<title type="sub">for the Use of the United Churches of Christ Church and St. Peter's Church in Philadelphia</title>

To the Reverend M? RICHARD PETERS, RECTOR of the United Churches of Christ CHURCH and St. Peter's CHURCH,In PHILADELPHIA. [Sing we Praises to the Lord] The following poem is scored for music in the source text. [1] Sing we Praises to the Lord. Halle. Hallelujah. Bless his Name ? one Accord Halle. Hallelujah. For 'tis owing to his Care Halle. Hallelujah. What we have & what we are Halle. Hallelujah. 2 He first made us by his Power. And preserves us evry Hour Food and Payment all are His, Present comforts future Bliss 3 He direct our Steps by Day Pointing out the safest Way. And at Night in mercy Still. Guards us from all kinds of Ill 4 God forgave us when Undone. And redeemed us by his Son: Raise your Voices then and Sing Loud Hosanahs to our King. [When all thy Mercies oh my God my rising Soul surveys] The following poem is scored for music in the source text. When all thy Mercies oh my God my rising Soul surveys. transported ? the View I'm lost in Wonder Love & Praise, in Wonder Love & Praise Oh how shall Words ? equal Warmth the Gratitude declare. that glows within my ravish'd Heart, but thou canst read it there, but thou canst read it there. [The spacious Firmament on high] The following poem is scored for music in the source text. The spacious Firmament on high, ? all the blue ethereal Sky. And spangled Heav'ns a shining Frame, their great Original proclaim. The unwearied Sun from day to Day doth his Creators Pow'r display And Publishes to ev'ry Land The Work of an almighty Hand Hallelujah Hallelujah Hallelujah Hallelujah Halle Hallelujah. [Thro all the changing scenes of Life in Trouble and in Joy] The following poem is scored for music in the source text. Thro all the changing scenes of Life in Trouble and in Joy The Praises of my God shall still my Heart and Tongue employ For in Distress to him I Pray'd He to my rescue came Since He Vouchsaf'd his friendly Aid for me I'll bless his Name Hallelujah Hallelujah Hallelujah Hallelujah Hallelujah Hallelujah Hallelujah Hallellujah [When we our wearied limbs to rest sat down by proud Euphrates Stream] The following poem is scored for music in the source text. When we our wearied limbs to rest sat down by proud Euphrates Stream We wept, we wept, with doleful thoughts: for Zion was our mournful Theme Our Harps that when ? Joy we sung were wont their tuneful Parts to bear with silent string neglected hung On Willow Trees that wither'd there. [My Soul thy Great Creator praise] The following poem is scored for music in the source text. My Soul thy Great Creator praise When cloth'd in his celestial Rays He in full Majesty appears And like a Robe his Glory wears Great is the Lord what Tongue can frame An equal Honour to his Name. The Heav'ns are for his Curtains Spread Th' Unfathom'd Depth he makes his Bed Clouds are his Chariots when he Rides On winged Storms across the Skies Great is the Lord &c [Ye Tribes of Adam Join With Earth and Air and Seas] The following poem is scored for music in the source text. Ye Tribes of Adam Join With Earth and Air and Seas to offer Notes divine to your Creator's Praise ye holy Throng of Angels bright in Worlds of Light begin the Song [Oh Lord that art my righteous Judge] The following poem is scored for music in the source text. Oh Lord that art my righteous Judge to my complaint give Ear Thou still redeemst me from Distress Have Mercy Lord and Hear [The Lord himself the mighty Lord] The following poem is scored for music in the source text. The Lord himself the mighty Lord. Vouchsafes to be my Guide. The Shepherd by whose tender Care my Wants are all suplied. [Praise ye the Lord & Imortal choir that fill the Realms above] The following poem is scored for music in the source text. Praise ye the Lord & Imortal choir that fill the Realms above Praise him who form'd you of his fire and feeds you with his love Shine to his Praise ye chrystal Skies the Floor of his Abode, or veil in Shades your thousand eyes Before your brighter God Hallelujah. [Sing to the Lord a new made Song] The following poem is scored for music in the source text. Sing to the Lord a new made Song Who wondrous things has done With his right hand and holy Arm The Conquest he has won
